titleStmt.title: A compleat history of the most remarkable providences both of judgment and mercy, which have hapned in this present age extracted from the best writers, the author's own observations, and the numerous relations sent him from divers parts of the three kingdoms : to which is added, whatever is curious in the works of nature and art / the whole digested into one volume, under proper heads, being a work set on foot thirty years ago, by the Reverend Mr. Pool, author of the Synopsis criticorum ; and since undertaken and finish'd, by William Turner...
titleStmt.author: Turner, William, 1653-1701.

notesStmt.note: "Recommended as useful to ministers in furnishing topicks of reproof and exhortation, and to private Christians for their closets and families."
"The wonders of nature. Part II" and "The curiosities of art. Part III" each have special t.p. and separate paging.
Publisher's list: last two pages at end.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
